page.title: 08Lanes: transport
page.content: Along the lanes the four regular large vehicles are the daily milk-collecting lorry, our twice-daily primary school bus and two buses for the secondary pupils during the term-time. Otherwise tractors, cars, cyclists, horses and pedestrians use the lanes, being always aware that the unexpected may be round the next blind corner(of which there are many). Part of the lane system is the track of an old Roman road to Gloucester.The lanes are damp much of the year and are liable to flood.During snowy weather some of the children managed to trudge up to 2 miles to school while others were given lifts on tractors. A variety of wild flowers and birds can be seen here including Little Owls, Kestrels Martins, Swans and Geese.
